Crimes.Crime_Name: Medical Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Grounds_for_Claim: Potential excessive demand on health or social services due to son's medical condition
Government_Body_or_Authority: Visa officer, Immigration Appeal Division (IAD), Federal Court
Assessment_Standard: Reasonable expectation of excessive demand on health or social services
Complaint_Issues: Lack of individualized assessment by visa officer
Role_of_Person: Applicant (mother), dependent child with medical condition
Enforcement_Action: Denial of visa based on medical inadmissibility
Claimant_Status: Foreign national applying under family class
Victim_Basis: Mother denied reunification due to son’s condition

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to Conduct Individualized Assessment under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Legal_Issue: Did the visa officer fail to conduct an individualized assessment?
Application_Facts: Visa officer relied on generic conclusions about son’s medical condition without considering family support
Decision_Outcome: IAD allowed appeal and substituted its own determination; Federal Court dismissed judicial review
Court_Ruling: No error by IAD; decision upheld
Defendant_Behavior: Visa officer failed to request sufficient individualized information
Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of individualized assessment violating procedural fairness
Legal_Standard: Requirement for individualized assessment under IRPA and case law
Assessment_Factor: Potential excessive demand on social services, availability of family support
Procedural_Issue: Failure to invite relevant information for individualized assessment
Application_Basis: Medical inadmissibility due to dependent child’s condition
Evidence_Assessed: Medical reports, caregiver plans, financial support capacity
Relief_Sought: Overturn visa refusal, allow permanent residence
Governing_Rule: Supreme Court precedent requiring individualized assessments
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Visa officer did not adequately solicit personal circumstances
Harm_Assessment: Risk of separation from family member
Cause_Description: Denial based on blanket assumption without personalized evaluation
Evidence_Handling: IAD considered new evidence; visa officer did not request it initially
Legal_Provision_Violated: IRPA s.67 – duty to assess fairly
Evidence_Assessment: IAD conducted proper assessment; visa officer did not
Decision_Rationale: Individualized assessment is mandatory; failure renders decision unreasonable
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of opportunity to provide tailored evidence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to IAD decision
